Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the bucket size directly impacts the number of buckets used for rendering the scene, which can significantly affect rendering performance and quality. The configuration involves clamping the bucket size between 16 and 512, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the computation of the number of buckets in each direction and the subsequent processing of various other options related to anti-aliasing, filter settings, and QMC sampling contribute to time-expensive and memory-expensive operations within the related code, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
